sections.title: Description
sections.raw_content: The getpriority function returns the priority of an executing process in a concurrent program. A smaller value means a faster speed.
sections.text_content: The getpriority function returns the priority of an executing process in a concurrent program.  A smaller value means a faster speed.
sections.mdown_content: The **getpriority** function returns the priority of an executing **process** in a concurrent program.  A smaller value means a faster speed.

sections.title: Status
sections.raw_content:
Part of the language and only conceptually part of the Concurrency unit.

This means that you can only call the function by calling getpriority, not by calling Concurrency.getpriority.
sections.text_content:
Part of the language and only conceptually part of the Concurrency unit. 
This means that you can only call the function by calling getpriority, not by calling Concurrency.getpriority.
sections.mdown_content:
Part of the language and only conceptually part of the **Concurrency** unit. 

This means that you can only call the function by calling **getpriority**, not by calling **Concurrency.getpriority**.
